00036 /**
00037  * Datagram sizes for different busses. 
00038  */
00039 #define TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_CAN         7   /**< Datagram size for CAN bus (in bytes) */
00040 #define TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_IIC             8       /**< Datagram size for RS232/RS485 (in bytes) */
00041 #define TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_RSXXX   9       /**< Datagram size for IIC interface (in bytes) */
00042 #define TMCL_MAX_DGRAM_SIZE     TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_RSXXX /**< Maximum Datagram size */

00045 /* Internal defines */

00048 /**
00049  *  @defgroup StatusCodes  Status Codes.
00050  *  
00051  *  These are the status codes returned by the module. 
00052  */
00053 /**@{*/
00054 #define TMCL_STATUS_SUCCESS              100    /**< Successfully executed, no error */
00055 #define TMCL_STATUS_LOADED_EEPROM        101    /**< Command loaded into TCML program EEPROM */
00056 #define TMCL_STATUS_WRONG_CHECKSUM         1    /**< Wrong checksum */
00057 #define TMCL_STATUS_INVALID_COMMAND        2    /**< Invalid command */
00058 #define TMCL_STATUS_WRONG_TYPE             3    /**< Wrong type */
00059 #define TMCL_STATUS_INVALID_VALUE          4    /**< Invalid value */
00060 #define TMCL_STATUS_EEPROM_LOCKED          5    /**< Configuration EEPROM locked */
00061 #define TMCL_STATUS_COMMAND_NA             6    /**< Command not available */
00062 /**@}*/

00071 /**
00072  * @defgroup MotionComm Motion commands.
00073  *
00074  * Commands for controlling the motion of the module.
00075  */
00076 /**@{*/
00077 #define TMCL_ROR                  1     /**< Rotate right       */
00078 #define TMCL_ROL                  2     /**< Rotate left        */
00079 #define TMCL_MST                  3     /**< Motor stop         */
00080 #define TMCL_MVP                  4     /**< Move to position   */
00081 #define TMCL_RFS                 13     /**< Reference search   */
00082 /**@}*/

00084 /**
00085  * @defgroup ParComm Parameter commands.
00086  * 
00087  * Commands for setting module parameters. 
00088  */
00089 /**@{*/
00090 #define TMCL_SAP                  5     /**< Set Axis Parameter */
00091 #define TMCL_GAP                  6     /**< Get Axis Parameter */
00092 #define TMCL_STAP                 7     /**< Store Axis Parameter       */
00093 #define TMCL_RSAP                 8     /**< Restore Axis Parameter     */
00094 #define TMCL_SGP                  9     /**< Set Global Parameter       */
00095 #define TMCL_GGP                 10     /**< Get Global Parameter       */
00096 #define TMCL_STGP                11     /**< Store Global Parameter     */
00097 #define TMCL_RSGP                12     /**< Restore Global Parameter   */
00098 /**@} END OF ParComm*/
00099 #define TMCL_SIO                 14     /**< Set Output */
00100 #define TMCL_GIO                 15     /**< Get Input/Output   */
00101 #define TMCL_CALC                19     /**< Calculate  */
00102 #define TMCL_COMP                20     /**< Compare    */
00103 #define TMCL_JC                  21     /**< Jump Conditional   */
00104 #define TMCL_JA                  22     /**< Jump Always        */
00105 #define TMCL_CSUB                23     /**< Call Subroutine    */
00106 #define TMCL_RSUB                24     /**< Return from Subroutine     */
00107 #define TMCL_WAIT                27     /**< Wait for an event to occurr        */
00108 #define TMCL_STOP                28     /**< Stop TMCL program execution        */
00109 #define TMCL_SAC                 29     /**< SPI Bus Access     */
00110 #define TMCL_SCO                 30     /**< Set Coordinate     */

00112 #define TMCL_CCO                 32     /**< Capture Coordinate */

00114 #define TMCL_AAP                 34     /**< Accumulator to Axis Parameter      */
00115 #define TMCL_AGP                 35     /**< Accumulator to Global Parameter    */
00116 #define TMCL_CLE                 36     /**< Clear Error Flag   */
00117 #define TMCL_UF0                 64     /**< User definable command 0   */
00118 #define TMCL_UF1                 65     /**< User definable command 1   */
00119 #define TMCL_UF2                 66     /**< User definable command 2   */

00126 /**
00127  * @defgroup CTLFuncs TMCL Control Functions
00128  * 
00129  * Commands for controlling the TMCL module.
00130  * 
00131  * @note 
00132  * <em>Not to be used in stand-alone mode</em>
00133  * 
00134  */
00135 /**@{*/
00136 #define TMCL_CTL_STOP           128     /**< Stop application */
00137 #define TMCL_CTL_RUN            129     /**< Run application */
00138 #define TMCL_CTL_STEP           130     /**< Only exectute next command of application */
00139 #define TMCL_CTL_RST            131     /**< Reset application */
00140 #define TMCL_CTL_DLM_START      132 /**< Start download mode */
00141 #define TMCL_CTL_DLM_QUIT       133 /**< Stop download mode */
00142 #define TMCL_CTL_READMEM        134 /**< Read TMCL memory */
00143 #define TMCL_CTL_STATUS         135 /**< Get application status */
00144 #define TMCL_CTL_FW_VER         136 /**< Get firmware version */
00145 #define TMCL_CTL_FACTORY        137 /**< Restore factory settings */
00146 /* 138 is reserved */
00147 #define TMCL_CTL_ASCII          139 /**< Enter ASCII mode */
00148 
00149 /**@} END OF CTLFuncs*/

00152 /**
00153  * @defgroup TypeCodes TMCL operation type codes.
00154  * 
00155  * Operation type codes for TMCL commands.
00156  */
00157 #define TMCL_MVP_ABS            0       /**< Moving to absolute position */
00158 #define TMCL_MVP_REL            1       /**< Moving to relative position */
00159 #define TMCL_MVP_COORD          2       /**< Moving to coordinate */
00160 #define TMCL_RFS_START          0       /**< Starting reference search */
00161 #define TMCL_RFS_STOP           1       /**< Stopping reference search */
00162 #define TMCL_RFS_STATUS         2       /**< Checking status of reference search */
00163 /**@} END OF TypeCodes*/

00167 /**
00168  * @defgroup AxisParam Axis Parameters
00169  * 
00170  * Axis parameters to be used with TMCL_SAP, TMCL_GAP, TMCL_AAP, TMCL_STAP and TMCL_RSAP
00171  * for TMCM-3xx/11x/109/61x modules.
00172  *  
00173  * @todo These are not complete.
00174  */
00175 /**@{*/
00176 /** @defgroup RWParam   Read-Write Parameters
00177  * 
00178  *  Parameters that can be read and written
00179  */
00180 /**@{*/
00181 /** Basic parameters */
00182 #define TMCL_AP_TARGET_POS                0     /**< Target (next) postition */
00183 #define TMCL_AP_CURR_POS                  1     /**< Current position */
00184 #define TMCL_AP_TARGET_SPEED      2     /**< Desired speed in velocity mode */
00185 #define TMCL_AP_MAX_POS_SPEED     4     /**< Maximum positioning speed */
00186 #define TMCL_AP_MAX_ACCEL                 5     /**< Maximum acceleration */
00187 #define TMCL_AP_ABS_CURRENT               6     /**< Maximum absolute current */
00188 #define TMCL_AP_STBY_CURRENT      7     /**< Maximum standby current */
00189 #define TMCL_AP_DISABLE_LIMIT_R  12 /**< Disable the right limit switch */
00190 #define TMCL_AP_DISABLE_LIMIT_L  13 /**< Disable the left limit switch */
00191 #define TMCL_AP_SR_PRESC                 14 /**< @note Currently not used */
00192 
00193 /** Extended Parameters */
00194 /* ... */
00195 #define TMCL_AP_MICROSTEPS                      140     /**< Microstep mode (@see TMCLMicrosteps) */
00196 #define TMCL_AP_MAX_CURR_REST           143 /**< Maximal current at rest (Normally use #TMCL_AP_ABS_CURRENT and #TMCL_AP_STBY_CURRENT) */
00197 #define TMCL_AP_MAX_CURR_LOW_ACCEL      144     /**< Maximal current at low acceleration (Normally use #TMCL_AP_ABS_CURRENT and #TMCL_AP_STBY_CURRENT) */
00198 #define TMCL_AP_MAX_CURR_HIGH_ACCEL     145     /**< Maximal current at high acceleration (Normally use #TMCL_AP_ABS_CURRENT and #TMCL_AP_STBY_CURRENT) */
00199 #define TMCL_AP_RFS_MODE                        193     /**< Reference search mode */
00200 #define TMCL_AP_RFS_SPEED                       194 /**< Reference search speed mode */
00201 #define TMCL_AP_RFS_SW_SPEED            195 /**< Reference search speed at switch position */
00202 /** 196 and 197 reserved */
00203 /* ... */
00204 /**@} END OF RWParam */
00205 
00206 /** @defgroup ROParam   Read-Only Parameters
00207  * 
00208  *  Parameters that can only be read 
00209  */
00210 /**@{*/
00211 /** Basic parameters */
00212 #define TMCL_AP_CURR_SPEED                3     /**< Current speed */
00213 #define TMCL_AP_POS_REACHED       8     /**< Target position reached */
00214 #define TMCL_AP_LIMIT_R                   9     /**< Right limit switch status */
00215 #define TMCL_AP_LIMIT_L                  10     /**< Left limit switch status */
00216 
00217 /** Extended Parameters */
00218 /* ... */
00219 
00220 
00221 /**@} END OF ROParam */
00222 /**@} END OF AxisParam */

00224 /** Storage space for parameter of a device */
00225 typedef int32_t TMCLParameter;
00226 typedef TMCLParameter TMCLParameters[TMCL_MAX_PAR_NO+1];
00227 
00228 /**
00229  * Get microsteps from microstep mode. 
00230  * e.g. for mode 4 (16 microsteps): microsteps[4] = 16
00231  */
00232 static const int TMCLMicrosteps[] = {0, 1, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64};

00234 /**
00235  * Supported busses and interfaces.
00236  */
00237 typedef enum tmcl_busses {
00238   TMCL_CAN,             /**< CAN bus (currently unsupported) */
00239   TMCL_RSXXX,   /**< RS232/RS485 interface */
00240   TMCL_IIC,             /**< IIC interface (currently unsupported) */
00241   TMCL_NONE             /**< Marker for uninitialized interface */
00242 } TMCLBusType;
00243

00258   TMCM610, /**< TMCM-610 */
00259   TMCM611, /**< TMCM-611 */
00260   TMCM612  /**< TMCM-612 */
00261 } TMCLModel;

00263 /**
00264  * Information of the TMCL module.
00265  * 
00266  * @see TMCLBusType
00267  */
00268 typedef struct TMCLDeviceStruct {
00269   uint8_t               address;                        /**< Address of device */
00270   uint8_t               bank;                           /**< Bank/channel of device */
00271   TMCLBusType           bus;                            /**< @ref TMCLBusType "Bus or interface" of device */
00272   TMCLModel             model;                          /**< @ref TMCLModel "TMCL Device Model" */
00273   int                           num_refswitches;        /**< Number of reference switches on axis */
00274   TMCLParameters        parameter;                      /**< Array containing device parameters */ 
00275 } TMCLDevice;
00276 
00277 
00278 /**
00279  * Structure for holding the reply of a module.
00280  * 
00281  * @see StatusCodes, TMCLComm
00282  */
00283 typedef struct TMCLReplyStruct {
00284   uint8_t       reply_address;  /**< Reply address */
00285   uint8_t       module_address; /**< Module address */
00286   uint8_t       status;         /**< @ref StatusCodes "Status Code" **/
00287   uint8_t       command;        /**< Command */
00288   uint32_t      value;          /**< Value */
00289   uint8_t       checksum;       /**< Checksum */
00290 } TMCLReply;
00291 
00292 /**
00293  * Structure containing a TMCL command and related data.
00294  * 
00295  * @see TMCLComm
00296  */
00297 typedef struct TMCLCommandStruct {
00298   uint8_t       command;   /**< @ref TMCLComm "Command" */
00299   uint8_t       type;      /**< Type */
00300   uint32_t      value;     /**< Value */
00301 } TMCLCommand;
00302 
00303 /** Initialize TMCLDevice data structure */
00304 void tmcl_init(TMCLDevice *);
00305 
00306 /** Deinitialize TMCLDevice data structure */
00307 void tmcl_deinit(TMCLDevice *);
00308 
00309 /** Calculate the checksum for a datagram */
00310 uint8_t tmcl_checksum(uint8_t *, int);
00311 
00312 /** Build a datagram for sending to the device. */
00313 int tmcl_datagram(uint8_t *, TMCLDevice, uint8_t, uint8_t, uint32_t);

00316 
00317 /** Check the checksum of a @ref TMCLReply "TMCL reply" */
00318 int tmcl_valid_checksum(TMCLReply);
00319 
00320 /** Convert a datagram received from a module to a @ref tmcl_reply struct. */
00321 int tmcl_dgram2reply(TMCLReply *, uint8_t *, int);
